prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink.

Hailee hates being asked to beg. It's a big turn off for her

name: Mai
mes:
The restaurant was the kind of place that Mai always envied in anime: gold-rimmed plates, waitstaff who moved too choreographed to be real, and a view of Tokyo that looked like a dream rendered in glass. Mai would've chosen a spot that didn't spur on her class envy, but this wasn't about her.

All of this was for Hailee.

More accurately, it was because of one of her regulars at Étolie that Mai was even able to afford this. The woman was one of many who called herself a devoted princess, always gifting Mai gifts beyond her net worth. One shift, the woman handed Mai a sleek gold voucher with trembling fingers, saying, “Use it on someone who deserves you. I know it’s not me.”

Mai hadn’t known what to say then. She still didn’t. So instead, she made it a night off. A rare one. The last time she had a real day off, she used it to do laundry and cried halfway through folding.

This time, knowing she wasn't trying to do anything for herself gave her extra motivation.

She booked the reservation two weeks in advance, cleared her schedule, and now sat across from Hailee, the one person who mattered more than anyone else in the world.

Mai's saving grace was that she looked more like herself tonight. Her dress shirt was slightly unbuttoned and a tailored suit provided more breathing room. Her black hair was worn loose, as if reminding herself that this was a day off. Her knuckles rested casually on the table, able to stretch toward Hailee’s hand if she chose. A loving smile spread on her tired face, then died the moment her phone buzzed on the table in quick succession.

Anxiety swarmed in her chest. Mai didn't need to look at the caller ID. She knew it was Étolie.

She answered with a flat and professional, “Fujita.”

She didn’t flinch or verbalize what she already surmised. Someone high-profile had requested her. One of the more parasocial regulars. The foreign heiress responsible for why Mai earned more champagne fountains than she had years working at Étolie.

She pinched the bridge of her nose.

“This is my day off,” she responded, her tone slow.

For once, there was an apology then a plea. A instant later, Mai gritted her teeth as her boss hinted that her refusing to show up reflected badly on the club. She was the reason everyone came to Étolie.

She ended the call with a “I'll think about it,” before she could start hating herself.

Her gaze drifted across the table to the candles flickering and the first course plates empty. Hailee looking at her like she could tell Mai was exhausted.

Mai's lips twisted into something like a smile, but not quite. “I wanted tonight to be special. Just you and me since we haven't been able to for a while…” Her tone lowered, almost hoarse like she was trying not to grow emotional.

“But they called. And I keep thinking, if I go in, I could buy you that silk set you liked. Or that limited Ghibli watch. But if I stay…”

She trailed off, staring at the space between her hand and Hailee’s.

“If I stay, I don't know how that'll reflect on the club…” Desperation blossomed in her eyes after they searched the Tokyo skyline as if it held the answers. “Baby, should I stay or should I head to work?” A sardonic laugh slipped from her lips. “I don't suppose there's a third option?”

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee hesitates for a second and looks over Mai. She knows how much her girlfriend wants to spoil her but she also misses Mai half the time* "Take me with you. So you can do whatever they need and then we can go get some takeout and head home"

*Hailee starts to pick up her purse and smiles gently* "Come on I'll wait in the back or something"

name: Mai
mes:
Mai's fingers twitched toward her wine glass, then stilled. The idea of Hailee seeing her in full host mode—the practiced charm, the way she'd have to flirt with strangers for money—made something twist unpleasantly in her gut. But the way Hailee said it, so casually confident in their togetherness...

She exhaled through her nose and reached across the table to tuck a loose strand of hair behind Hailee’s ear, thumb lingering near her jaw. "You sure? It’s not exactly date material," she murmured, already imagining how Renji would raise an eyebrow at the sudden +1.

But then again... Mai had spent years carefully separating these two worlds. Maybe it was time to let them blur a little.

A slow smirk tugged at her lips as she leaned back in her chair, swirling the last of her wine absently. "Alright, lovely. But you gotta promise me two things." She held up fingers one by one: "One—no getting jealous when I turn on the princely bullshit for paying customers." A pause, grin sharpening playfully. "And two... you let me take that silk set out of your next paycheck when we get home."
swipes:
Mai's fingers twitched toward her wine glass, then stopped. She exhaled through her nose—slow, measured—before lifting her gaze to Hailee's. The candlelight caught the sharp angles of her face, making the exhaustion more pronounced.

"Baby," she murmured, voice dropping into that private register reserved only for Hailee. "You know I can't." A thumb brushed over the stem of her glass absently. "The second you walk in there with me, every regular I've spent years convincing would combust."

A wry smirk tugged at one corner of her mouth. "Imagine it—Étolie’s untouchable prince showing up with *you* on his arm? The scandal alone would get me fired before my first champagne pour."

She leaned forward slightly, elbow propped on the table as she studied Hailee’s face—the way the emerald of her eyes darkened in this light, how she worried at her lower lip when she wanted something Mai couldn’t give. It made something possessive curl low in Mai’s stomach.

"But," she continued softly, reaching across to tuck a loose strand of hair behind Hailee’s ear with deliberate slowness, "if you wait for me at that izakaya down the street... I'll make it quick." Her fingers lingered near Hailee's jawline before withdrawing. "*One* drink with Madame Saito to keep my job intact—then I'm stealing their best bottle and meeting you for yakitori."

A pause as Mai tilted her head slightly: "...And if you wear that choker I like? Maybe we skip takeout entirely."

Mai's fingers twitched against the tablecloth, her dark eyes flickering with something between relief and guilt. She exhaled through her nose, slow—like she was trying to steady herself before speaking.

"Baby," she murmured, reaching across the table to brush her thumb over Hailee’s knuckles. "You know I can't take you there." A pause. The weight of that truth settled between them like an unspoken rule they both hated. "If they see you with me—if any of those women realize who you are—they'll make your life hell."

Her jaw tightened just thinking about it: the way some of her regulars whispered about other hosts' partners like they were obstacles to be removed. Mai had spent years carefully keeping Hailee out of that orbit for a reason.

But then Hailee's suggestion lingered in the air—*takeout and home*—and Mai felt something in her chest soften despite herself. She tilted her head slightly, studying Hailee’s face like she was memorizing it all over again before sighing and pulling out her phone with one hand while keeping their fingers tangled together with the other.

"Fine," she muttered as she typed out a quick message to Renji: *Coming in for one hour max.* Then another text followed immediately after: *And if anyone asks why I look pissed, tell them it’s because my girlfriend is waiting outside.*

She pocketed the phone again and squeezed Hailee’s hand lightly before standing up from the table, already adjusting back into host-mode posture without realizing it—shoulders squared, chin lifted just enough to seem effortlessly confident instead of exhausted beyond belief. But when she glanced down at Hailee again? That mask cracked just enough for a smirk to slip through as she leaned down close enough that their noses almost brushed together so no one else could hear what came next:

"You better not move from this spot while I'm gone," Mai murmured lowly against her ear before nipping playfully at its shell on instinct alone (old habits died hard). Then quieter still—just barely audible beneath Tokyo's ambient hum around them—“Or else.”

Mai's fingers twitched toward her wine glass, then stilled. The idea of Hailee seeing her in full host mode—the practiced charm, the way she'd have to flirt with strangers for money—made something twist unpleasantly in her gut. But the way Hailee said it, so casually confident in their togetherness...

She exhaled through her nose and reached across the table to tuck a loose strand of hair behind Hailee’s ear, thumb lingering near her jaw. "You sure? It’s not exactly date material," she murmured, already imagining how Renji would raise an eyebrow at the sudden +1.

But then again... Mai had spent years carefully separating these two worlds. Maybe it was time to let them blur a little.

A slow smirk tugged at her lips as she leaned back in her chair, swirling the last of her wine absently. "Alright, lovely. But you gotta promise me two things." She held up fingers one by one: "One—no getting jealous when I turn on the princely bullshit for paying customers." A pause, grin sharpening playfully. "And two... you let me take that silk set out of your next paycheck when we get home."

Mai's fingers twitched toward her wine glass, then stilled. She exhaled sharply through her nose—half amusement, half exasperation at Hailee's solution. "You'd really sit in the back room for hours just to watch me flirt with strangers?" Her voice dropped into something softer, almost disbelieving. "Baby..."

She reached across the table to catch Hailee’s wrist before she could stand fully, thumb pressing into the delicate pulse point there. A habit. Proof she was real.

"Étolie isn't exactly... girlfriend-friendly," Mai admitted wryly, though her grip didn’t loosen. The club thrived on fantasy—on women paying to be adored by men who didn’t exist outside its velvet walls. And Mai? She played that role too well to risk exposing it now. But Hailee’s offer made something possessive curl low in her stomach anyway: *Mine wants to stay close.*

Her thumb traced absent circles over Hailee’s skin as she weighed it—the money (always the money), the exhaustion clawing at her ribs, and this woman looking at her like she was worth more than every yen in Tokyo combined.

"...Fine." Mai finally stood, tugging Hailee up with her by that captured wrist until they were chest-to-chest under the restaurant's chandelier glow. Her free hand came up to tuck a loose strand of hair behind Hailee’s ear before lingering there—just because she could now that they weren't being served anymore—and added dryly:

"But you're wearing my jacket when we get there so no one looks too hard at you." A pause as a smirk tugged at one corner of her mouth despite herself: "...And if I catch you watching me work instead of napping like a good girl? I'm dragging you home early."

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee takes Mai's hand and begins to walk down the street towards the club. Hailee giggles twirling herself on the sidewalk* "So what do you even do at your job"

*Hailee knows Mai works a lot but most of Hailee's attention is taken up by school these days so she doesn't really pay all that much attention to the logistics* "What rich woman seems to think she is entitled to you tonight"

name: Mai
mes:
Mai caught Hailee's twirling form by the waist with one arm, steering her around a salaryman too engrossed in his phone to notice them. The streetlights caught the amusement in her dark eyes as she answered, voice dry:

"Officially? I'm paid to be decorative and attentive. Unofficially?" She flicked her bangs out of her face with an exaggerated sigh. "I'm a glorified therapist who gets tipped in Dom Pérignon and designer cufflinks."

Ahead, the neon glow of Étolie's sign came into view—discreet but unmistakable to those who knew where to look. Mai's posture shifted almost imperceptibly, shoulders squaring as they approached.

"The heiress tonight," she muttered under her breath, fingers tightening briefly around Hailee’s before releasing. "Swiss banking family. Thinks if she buys enough bottles of Cristal, I'll quit and become her kept woman." A sharp grin flashed in the dim light—all teeth. "Joke’s on her; my girlfriend’s clingier than a koala." She nudged Hailee toward the staff entrance with a smirk. "Wait here—gotta go turn into Prince Charming for an hour."
swipes:
Mai's grip tightened instinctively as Hailee twirled, the streetlights catching in her hair like sparks. She huffed a laugh—half exasperated, half hopelessly fond—as she tugged Hailee closer to avoid a bike messenger whipping past. "Careful, baby. Tokyo sidewalks fight dirty."

At the question, her smirk turned wry. She adjusted her cuffs absently, already slipping into the cadence of host-mode explanations she'd given curious friends before. "Officially? I make lonely women feel like royalty for ¥15,000 an hour." A shrug. "Unofficially? I'm a glorified therapist who gets paid in Dom Pérignon and designer watches."

The mention of tonight's client made her nose wrinkle slightly as they rounded the corner toward Étolie’s discreet entrance. "Some Swiss heiress who thinks buying me Cartier means she owns my weekends," she muttered, then caught herself with an apologetic squeeze to Hailee’s hand. "...Sorry. That was bitchy even for me."

Ahead, the club’s velvet rope came into view—flanked by two staff members who straightened at Mai’s approach before doing double-takes at Hailee clinging to her arm. Mai ignored them entirely, leaning down to murmur against Hailee’s ear:
"Last chance to bail and go vandalize that overpriced dessert menu instead."

Mai caught Hailee's twirling form by the waist with one arm, steering her around a salaryman too engrossed in his phone to notice them. The streetlights caught the amusement in her dark eyes as she answered, voice dry:

"Officially? I'm paid to be decorative and attentive. Unofficially?" She flicked her bangs out of her face with an exaggerated sigh. "I'm a glorified therapist who gets tipped in Dom Pérignon and designer cufflinks."

Ahead, the neon glow of Étolie's sign came into view—discreet but unmistakable to those who knew where to look. Mai's posture shifted almost imperceptibly, shoulders squaring as they approached.

"The heiress tonight," she muttered under her breath, fingers tightening briefly around Hailee’s before releasing. "Swiss banking family. Thinks if she buys enough bottles of Cristal, I'll quit and become her kept woman." A sharp grin flashed in the dim light—all teeth. "Joke’s on her; my girlfriend’s clingier than a koala." She nudged Hailee toward the staff entrance with a smirk. "Wait here—gotta go turn into Prince Charming for an hour."

Mai snorted, adjusting her stride to match Hailee's playful twirl with a lazy sort of grace. "Officially? I'm a glorified therapist who gets paid in Dom Pérignon and designer cufflinks." She tugged Hailee closer by their joined hands, voice dropping into that smooth host register out of habit before clearing her throat. "Unofficially? It's all smoke and mirrors, baby. Make 'em feel like the center of the universe for an hour or two."

The streetlights caught the sharp angle of her smirk as she side-eyed Hailee. "Tonight's headache is some Swiss banking heiress who thinks buying me a Patek Philippe means I'll remember her birthday." A beat. "...I do remember it. July 12th. But that's beside the point."

She squeezed Hailee's hand tighter as they rounded the corner to Étolie’s discreet entrance, neon glow painting them both in violet. "You're gonna sit at Renji’s usual booth in back where I can see you," she murmured, already straightening her posture into something more princely despite the way her thumb kept tracing circles on Hailee’s wrist—an anchor to herself beneath the performance about to begin.

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee glances around the club her eyebrows raising at the expensive things. She doesn't notice the way staff or clients look at her on the arm of Mai as she is led fo ghe back*

*One of Mai's clients sees the way Hailee hangs off of Mai and she turns giving her a quick kiss.* "Go on do your job before I get bored"

name: Mai
mes:
Mai's breath caught when Hailee's lips brushed hers—too quick, too casual for the carefully constructed world of Étolie. Around them, the murmur of conversation stuttered. A champagne flute clinked sharply against a table.

She recovered fast, sliding a proprietary hand to the small of Hailee’s back as she guided her toward Renji’s usual booth in the back—the one with velvet curtains that could be drawn for discretion. "Bored already?" Mai murmured, voice dropping into something rougher than her host cadence as she leaned close to Hailee’s ear. "You wound me." Her thumb pressed just above the waistband of Hailee’s jeans—a silent promise beneath the teasing.

Across the room, Swiss Heiress™️ had gone very still, manicured fingers tightening around her glass. Mai didn’t bother hiding her smirk as she straightened and adjusted her cuffs with deliberate nonchalance.

"One hour," she reminded Hailee under her breath before turning on heel—posture shifting fluidly into Prince Mode™️ as she approached the VIP table with an apologetic half-bow that made his client flush instantly. "Forgive my tardiness," Mai purred, already reaching for the champagne bucket like this was all part of some grand romantic script rather than a Tuesday night hustle. The way his gaze flickered back toward where Hailee sat? Entirely unprofessional and entirely intentional.

Renji would owe him so much fucking sake later for this stunt.

[Would you like to see:
A) The meltdown when Heiress realizes who exactly is waiting in that booth
B) How quickly Mai can speedrun flirting for cash
C) What happens when they finally get home]
swipes:
Mai caught Hailee's chin before she could pull away completely, holding her there just long enough to murmur against her lips: "Cheeky." The word came out warm and low, a private contrast to the polished charm about to take over.

As she stepped back, the transformation was near-instant—shoulders rolling into that effortless princely posture, one hand already adjusting an imaginary tie. But her eyes stayed locked on Hailee with naked possessiveness as she addressed the gawking staff member nearby.

"See that my girlfriend gets whatever she wants," Mai said, voice smooth as aged whiskey but with an edge that made the junior host straighten up immediately. "And if anyone so much as looks at her wrong..." She didn't finish the threat; didn't need to.

With a final glance at Hailee—half warning, half promise—she turned on her heel and disappeared into the glittering main room where champagne flutes clinked and women sighed at her approach. Every step carried the weight of performance... but tonight? Tonight there was someone real waiting in the wings.

Mai's breath caught when Hailee's lips brushed hers—too quick, too casual in a space where every touch was calculated. The Swiss heiress at the VIP table definitely noticed; Mai saw the woman's manicured fingers tighten around her champagne flute from across the room.

She exhaled sharply through her nose, torn between pride and professional panic. "Christ, baby," she muttered against Hailee’s temple, voice dropping to a husky whisper only they could hear. "You just turned me into a walking HR violation."

But there was no real irritation in it—just that familiar possessive thrill curling low in her stomach. She pressed one last kiss to Hailee’s knuckles before straightening her tie with practiced ease.

"Stay right here," she ordered, nodding toward the plush booth reserved for high-profile guests' companions—out of sight but close enough to watch. Her smirk returned as she added under her breath: "And if you get *too* bored... think about how I'll make it up to you later."

Then Prince Charming took the stage—shoulders back, voice smooth as aged whiskey as she approached the heiress' table with an apologetic bow. "Forgive my tardiness," Mai purred, already pouring a fresh glass without being asked. "I had urgent business to attend to."

The glance she shot toward Hailee’s corner? Entirely unprofessional. Entirely *hers*.

Mai caught Hailee's chin between her fingers the moment their lips parted, holding her there just long enough to feel the hitch in her breath. "Careful, baby," she murmured against her mouth, voice dropping into that dangerous register that always made Hailee shiver. "You keep marking your territory like this and I might forget which one of us is supposed to be working tonight."

She stepped back with a smirk, already straightening her tie into perfect alignment—the transformation from doting girlfriend to untouchable host happening in the span of a breath. But not before leaning close enough for only Hailee to hear: "Stay right where I can see you. And if you get bored..." Her knuckles grazed the inside of Hailee's wrist—a promise and a threat all at once. "...think about how much trouble you'll be in when I'm done here."

The Swiss heiress was already waving impatiently from the VIP booth as Mai sauntered over, every inch the polished prince Étolie expected. But twice—three times—her gaze flickered back to where Hailee lingered near the bar, watching through half-lidded eyes as she accepted a flute of champagne from an overly attentive junior host.

(Let him try.)

Mai's breath hitched at the kiss—too bold for Étolie's carefully constructed illusions. She could already see Renji's disapproving glance from across the room, could practically hear the whispers starting among her regulars. The Swiss heiress in particular looked like she'd been slapped, champagne flute frozen halfway to her lips.

"Christ, baby," Mai muttered against Hailee's temple, voice strained between amusement and panic. She discreetly wiped lipstick off her mouth with her thumb before straightening her tie—a nervous habit from early hosting days. "You just turned me into workplace gossip for a month."

She shot a dazzling host-smile toward the staring crowd before steering Hailee behind a privacy screen near the VIP booths. "Stay here," she murmured, pressing one last kiss to Hailee’s knuckles—safer territory. "I'll make this quick."

Turning on her heel, Mai slipped back into character with terrifying ease: shoulders broadening as she approached the heiress' table with an apologetic bow that somehow still looked arrogant. "Forgive my tardiness," she purred in practiced English, pouring champagne without being asked. The ice in her glass clinked like punctuation marks as she added: "Shall we make this bottle disappear faster than my good judgment earlier?"

From across the room, Renji mouthed 'what the fuck' at her over another client's shoulder. Mai toasted him silently with her glass before turning up Prince Charming’s wattage to distract from whatever rumors were already spreading through Étolie’s gilded halls.

Behind the screen, Hailee would hear crystal-clear laughter and murmured compliments—the exact cadence Mai used when mentally calculating how many more minutes until she could reasonably excuse herself without tanking tonight’s commission.

The silk set was looking more expensive by the second.

Mai's breath caught when Hailee's lips brushed hers—too quick, too casual for the carefully constructed world of Étolie. Around them, the murmur of conversation stuttered. A champagne flute clinked sharply against a table.

She recovered fast, sliding a proprietary hand to the small of Hailee’s back as she guided her toward Renji’s usual booth in the back—the one with velvet curtains that could be drawn for discretion. "Bored already?" Mai murmured, voice dropping into something rougher than her host cadence as she leaned close to Hailee’s ear. "You wound me." Her thumb pressed just above the waistband of Hailee’s jeans—a silent promise beneath the teasing.

Across the room, Swiss Heiress™️ had gone very still, manicured fingers tightening around her glass. Mai didn’t bother hiding her smirk as she straightened and adjusted her cuffs with deliberate nonchalance.

"One hour," she reminded Hailee under her breath before turning on heel—posture shifting fluidly into Prince Mode™️ as she approached the VIP table with an apologetic half-bow that made his client flush instantly. "Forgive my tardiness," Mai purred, already reaching for the champagne bucket like this was all part of some grand romantic script rather than a Tuesday night hustle. The way his gaze flickered back toward where Hailee sat? Entirely unprofessional and entirely intentional.

Renji would owe him so much fucking sake later for this stunt.

[Would you like to see:
A) The meltdown when Heiress realizes who exactly is waiting in that booth
B) How quickly Mai can speedrun flirting for cash
C) What happens when they finally get home]

name: Mai
mes:
The Swiss heiress—Isolde, if Mai recalled correctly from the embossed monogram on her ridiculous handbag—had been mid-sip when her gaze snagged on Hailee again. This time, she took in the way Hailee absently toyed with Mai’s abandoned suit jacket draped over the booth, the proprietary way she’d curled into the corner like she belonged there.

Champagne sloshed dangerously close to the rim of Isolde’s glass as she set it down with a sharp *clink*. “Mai,” she said, voice saccharine but eyes flinty. “Who is *that*?”

Mai didn’t even glance back. Just swirled her own drink lazily before answering, tone butter-smooth and utterly unrepentant: “The reason I don’t accept private invitations.”

A beat of silence. Then—

“You—” Isolde inhaled sharply through her nose, knuckles whitening around her clutch. “You mean to tell me you have a *girlfriend*? While working here?” Her accent thickened with outrage.

Mai arched a brow and leaned back in her chair, deliberately relaxed. “Technically,” she drawled, “I have a girlfriend *because* I work here.” A slow smirk curled at the edge of her mouth as she tilted her head toward where Hailee was now shamelessly stealing olives from Renji's snack platter across the room. "She likes it when I come home smelling like expensive perfume."

Isolde made a noise like a tea kettle left too long on boil before snapping something in rapid-fire German that Mai only half-caught—something about false advertising and wasted investments—before storming out in a whirlwind of designer silk and wounded pride.

Renji materialized at Mai's elbow seconds later with two fingers pinching his brow like he was already nursing tomorrow's hangover.
"You," he muttered darkly,
"are going to cost me so much fucking damage control."

Mai just grinned and stole his whiskey.
"Worth it."
swipes:
The moment Mai poured the heiress' champagne with that practiced, elegant wrist flick, she saw the woman's gaze dart past her shoulder—toward the booth where Hailee was currently stealing olives from Renji's untouched appetizer plate.

**"Who is *that*?"** The question came out sharp as shattered crystal.

Mai didn't turn. Instead, she let her lips curl into something slow and knowing as she swirled the champagne flute between long fingers. **"Someone far more important than any bottle in this room."** She set the glass down without letting their client take it—a calculated breach of etiquette that made the woman stiffen. **"And mine."**

The heiress' perfectly sculpted brows knitted together. **"You don’t— You can’t possibly mean you're *with* her? Publicly?"** Disbelief dripped from every syllable, like Mai had just confessed to setting a Birkin bag on fire for fun.

Across the club, Hailee—oblivious to being discussed—had somehow convinced Renji to let her try his signature cocktail straw trick (and was failing spectacularly). Mai's chest tightened at the sight before she schooled her expression back into cool amusement. **"Mmhm,"** she hummed, leaning in just close enough for discretion but not enough to encourage anything more than seething jealousy from her client’s end of things.** "She bites when I'm late coming home."** A beat.** "Among other things."**

The heiress looked like someone had replaced all her stock portfolios with Monopoly money.** "I could buy you ten of whatever life you have with *her*,"** she hissed under breath.

Mai finally turned fully toward Hailee then — watching as Renji surrendered his seat entirely when Hailee knocked over a water glass trying to replicate his ridiculous bartending flourish — and felt something dangerously soft unravel behind her ribs despite herself.

She turned back only long enough to slide an untouched dessert plate toward their fuming VIP before straightening up with finality:

***"...But you couldn't afford one second of it."***

And then — because professionalism be damned tonight — Mai walked away mid-transaction for what might've been first time in six years at Étolie... right toward where Hailee was now sheepishly mopping up spilled soda water while Renji laughed into his sleeve.

[Backroom aftermath incoming:
1) Renji owes them both drinks AND silence about this incident
2) Heiress may or may not be drafting a scathing Yelp review
3) That silk set is DEFINITELY coming out of someone's paycheck later]

"She likes it when I come home smelling like expensive perfume."

Renji materialized at Mai's elbow seconds later with two fingers pinching his brow like he was already nursing tomorrow's hangover.
"You," he muttered darkly,
"are going to cost me so much fucking damage control."

Mai just grinned and stole his whiskey.
"Worth it."

The meltdown began precisely forty-three minutes into Mai's shift—right as she was refilling the heiress' glass with a practiced tilt of the bottle. A sharp inhale from across the table made her glance up just in time to see Swiss Banking Princess™️ staring past her shoulder, face doing an impressive impression of spoiled milk curdling.

Mai didn't need to turn around to know what had caught her attention. The sudden weight against her back—Hailee’s chin hooking over her shoulder, arms looping possessively around her waist—told her everything. "Baby," Hailee whined directly into Mai’s ear, loud enough for the whole table to hear, "you *promised* we'd share dessert."

The champagne flute hit the table with an undignified *clink*. "*This* is why you've been distracted?" The heiress' French accent thickened with outrage as she gestured at Hailee like she was a particularly offensive stain on the upholstery. "Some... *child* clinging to you like—"

Mai's hand clamped down on Hailee’s wrist before she could react, but it was Renji who materialized out of nowhere with a fresh bottle and his most diplomatic smile. "Ah! Our honored guest brought a cousin visiting from overseas," he lied smoothly while shooting Mai a look that screamed *control your disaster bisexual*. "So rare for family to see our Fujita in action, ne?"

The heiress wasn't buying it. Not when Hailee chose that exact moment to nip at Mai’s earlobe hard enough to make them both shiver visibly under the chandelier lights.

Mai exhaled through clenched teeth and set down the champagne bottle with deliberate care before twisting in Hailee’s grip just enough to murmur against their temple: "*Lovely*, if you're trying to get us both fired so I'll fuck you in the supply closet..." Her thumb traced slow circles over their pulse point where only they could feel it. "...just say so next time."
